title.rendered: Handyman in Vaughan: 3 Ways To Repurpose Your Living Room

content.rendered:
With entertainment areas, dens, and family rooms taking over as gathering places in many homes, your living room may have become the least-used area in your house. Yet if you’re like most homeowners, you could always use some extra space to meet other needs. If that sounds like your situation, it’s time to transform your living room into a more useful spot in your home.

When you’re thinking about repurposing your living room, get in touch with Handyman Connection to find the top remodelling services in Vaughan. Read on for three cool ways to turn your unused space into the perfect new room.

Add an Extra Bedroom

Whether your family’s growing, your kids are ready for their own rooms, or you need more space for yourself, transforming your unused living room into sleeping quarters makes smart use of the unused square footage. Renovating an existing space is usually less expensive than building an addition, and the resale value of smaller homes increases when you increase the bedroom count. That means converting your living room eventually pays for itself.

Since most living rooms have at least one open wall, your contractor will close off the area for privacy, and he or she will advise on whether a French, barn, or standard door is best for both access and structural support. If you’re adding an en-suite bathroom, the team you’ve hired will also install the necessary plumbing, wiring, and fixtures to completely transform the room.

Expand Your Kitchen

For most families, the kitchen is the heart of the home, but if yours is cramped then expanding it into your living room space is a great way significantly improve its functionality. With the extra room, you can add a double oven, a commercial-sized fridge, and even a second dishwasher.

Having extra space also improves workflow in the kitchen. Use the triangle model and set up your sink, stove, and fridge in a pattern that lets you move easily between the three points. You’ll also have room to add or enlarge an existing walk-in pantry for better organization, improved access, and increased storage.

Create a Formal Dining Room

If you never seem to have enough space when entertaining, turning your living room into a formal dining room makes it a breeze to accommodate more guests for your next party. Once you’ve got the additional floor area for hosting friends and family, you’ll be able to buy a bigger dining table, include more seating, and add a buffet for food service.

For living rooms located next to kitchens, consider options like a connecting doorway or pass-through wall window so it’s simple to move meals and dishes back and forth. You could even dedicate space between each room to create a butler’s pantry that facilitates serving visitors. Finally, if the area abuts your patio, install French or sliding doors to make indoor/outdoor entertaining easy during the summer months.

Contact Handyman Connection When You’re Ready To Repurpose

To get your living room transformation underway, reach out to Handyman Connection to find the best contractor for the job. Whether you need a handyman in Vaughan to help with a simple makeover, or a remodelling team to handle a major renovation, we’ll hook you up with the right service providers who’ll exceed your expectations.

At Handyman Connection, we put you in touch with top professionals who are committed to outstanding service and high-quality workmanship. For repairs, renovations, and remodels at your home or office, our experts get the job done right! Hop online today to request your estimate, and then get ready to get the most out of your repurposed room!
